description: Copied A.H. 1014 [A.D. 1605] by Sulaymān ibn Muḥammad ibn Hāniʼ. Fols. 20; 20 x 14.9 cm.; written surface 15.5 x 10 cm.; 27 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; with catchwords; entries in red. A treatise on the composition of the zajal (iambic poems) and mawāliyā (ballads), with examples. Beg.: بسم الله ... الحمد لله رب العالمىن والعاقبة للمتقىن Colophon: تمت ... المبارکة والحمد لله وحده امىن امىن امىن تم Marginal notes and glosses; marginal summaries. On title page al-Funūn al-sabʻah appears as another title for the work. Evidently last few lines are by a different hand. MS in fair condition but several folios are mended; Arabic binding with flap. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900. Ahlwardt, Verzeichnis der arabischen Handschriften, 7170/1; Catalogue des manuscrits arabes de la Bibliothèque Nationale, 4454.
author: Banawānī, ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Yūsuf, 15th cent
title: Dafʻ al-shakk wa-al-mayn fī taḥrīr al-fannayn
creator: Banawānī, ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Yūsuf, 15th cent
subject: Arabic language—Versification—Early works to 1800
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
